DOC.brief_summary: The pathophysiology of acute ischemic pain is not well established. The aim of the present study was to investigate acute ischemic pain in humans with a view to establish a scientific model to perform future studies. The investigators examined whether peripheral nerve damage and acute inflammation occur during short episodes of acute ischemia.
DOC.brief_title: Investigating a Model for Acute Ischemic Pain in Humans
DOC.criteria: patients over 40 years unilateral femoralpopliteal PAD, Fontaine grade II patients with pain at rest or other pain origin diabetic polyneuropathy deep vein thrombosis
